title: V-2 rocket bomb outside Parliament House: Canberra
creator_contributor_role: Ernest Robertson Thain, director of photography
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Parliament House (Canberra, A.C.T.)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Canberra (A.C.T.) - Description and travel
abstract: With a population of 13,000 in 1947, this event drew quite a big crowd in Canberra.
description: On its journey from Melbourne to Sydney the V-2 rocket bomb on its special trailer was displayed out side Parliament House, Canberra. No lectures on the bomb's construction were given, but placards were hung about the missile, explaining its composition. Sections of the tail assembly had been cut away for exhibition purposes and the vital mechanism for propulsion painted in various colours to illustrate the source of the power. Estimates put the crowd who came to view the missile during the day at between two and six thousand, many coming from outlying districts.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002714; Canberra and War: the Australian War Memorial; Active; 2013
